Largest Army Longest Road Defender Of Catan Tradesman Constitution Printer Merchant Harbor Master Old Boot Wealthiest Settler Poorest Settler Discovered Island Damaged Road Capture Pirate Fortress Explorer
Given to player who has largest army Given to player with the longest road Awarded when a player single-handedly defends against Barbarians. Given to the player who controls the Merchant. When this prgress card is picked it is emmediately played and cannot be taken. When this progress card is picked it is emmediately played and cannot be taken. Given to last player who has placed the Merchant Player who has most harbor points gets this card Counts against your points so you need 1 extra point to win Given to player with most gold coins Given to player with fewest gold coins One given for each discovered island One of users roads is damaged Given for each pirate fortress conquered Given to player who has discovered most territories
Wood Produced by Forest Tiles Sheep Produced by Pasture Tiles Ore Produced by Mountains Tiles Wheat Produced by Fields Tiles Brick Produced by Hills Tiles
New Year Event cards wil be shuffled on next event card drawn. Robber
Attack Current player places the robber and all players discard half of your cards (round down). Same as rolling a '7' Epidemic Each player recieves 1 resource for a city (no commodity) Earthquake Each player has one of their roads damaged Good
Neighbor Each player give the player to their left 1 resource or commodity of the givers choice Tournament The player(s) with most (active) knights take 1 resource card Trade
Advantage The single player with longest road can take 1 resource card from another player Calm
Sea Player with the most harbors can take 1 resource card of their choice Robber
Flees Robber returns to the desert Neighborly
Assistance Player with most victory points gives a player of their choice a resource card of the givers choice if they have it. Conflict The single player with largest army (active knights) take a random resource or commodity card form another player Plentiful
Year Each player takes 1 resource of their choice from supply No Event The settlers labor and Catan prospers.
// Take all of one resource Monopoly force other players to give you resources of your choice YearOfPlenty Draw resources of your choice from pile Road Building Build 2 roads for free Victory Can be applied to your total points when the result winds you the game Soldier Use to place the robber Warship Convert a ship into a warship
Science Abbey Library Aqueduct Theatre University
Trade Market Trading House Merchant Guild Bank Bazaar
Politics Town Hall Church Fortress Cathedral Castle
Paper Can be exchanged for Science improvements Cloth Can be exchanged for Trade improvements Coin Can be exchanged for Politics improvements
Road Ship Warship Development Settlement City City Wall Knight Promote Knight Activate Knight
Knight Hood Place 1 knight on one of the unoccupied paths of the castle tile. Black Knight Place a knight on an open path of your choice. Intregue Remove a barbarian form a hex of your choice and add to your prisoners. If there are no more barbarians, then draw a new card. Treason Obtain 2 Gold and remove 2 barbarians from 2 different tiles (or from supply) and place on 2 other unconquered tiles.
%1$s has %2$d harbors %s has most harbors and gets to pick a resource card %s Has largest army and gets to take a resource card from another No single player with largest army so event cancelled %s must give a resource card to another player of their choice No event when 2 or more players have the same size army %s has longest road and gets to take a card form another No single player with the longest road so event cancelled Distributing resources for num %d %s has struck Gold! Cancel Cancel current operation Continue End your turn Soldier Move the robber or Pirate to cell of players choice Warship Turn one of your ships into a warship Monopoly Choose a Resource and all opponents give you that resource from their hand Year of Plenty Choose 2 Resources to add to your hand Trade View your trade options Development Draw random Development Card for cost of %s Move Ship Reposition an open ended ship Road Building Build two Routes for free Build Ship Position a new ship for cost of %s" Build Warship Upgrade an existing ship to a war ship for cost of %s. Warships can chase away the pirate. Attack a ship Your warship can attack an opponent's ship. Roll a die. If 1,2,3 then opponent wins and you lose your warship. On a 4,5,6 you win and opponent ship becomes yours. The midpoint of the die is shifted based on the difference in number of cities posessed be each player. Attack Fortress Roll the dice and take a chance at converting the fortress to a new settlement. Three wins converts the settlement. A loss makes you lose the 2 ships adjacent to the fortress. A win costs you 1 ship Build Road Position a new road for cost of %s Repair Road Repair your damaged road for cost of %s Build Settlement Position a new Settlement for cost of %s Build City Convert a settlement to a City for cost of %s Roll dice Deal Event Turn over the next event card Build Wall Build a wall around one of your cities for cost of %s. Wall be destroyed when barbarians win an attack but city is reserved Improve Politics Exchange Coin to improve city Politics. Upgrade to Cathedral coverts to Metropolis if not taken Improve Science Exchange Paper to improve city science. Upgrade to Theatre converts to a Metropolis if not taken Improve Trade Exchange Cloth to improve city trade.Upgrade to Bank converts to a Metropolis if not taken> Alchemist Playable Prior to die roll. Control outcome of 2 production dice Inventor Switch 2 tile number tokens that have values: 3,4,5,9,10,11 Crane Build a city improvement for 1 commodity card less than normal Irrigation Collect 2 wheat cards for each structure next to a wheat tile> Engineer Build 1 city wall for free Medicine Upgrade settlement to city for 2 ore and 1 wheat Smith Promote 2 knights for free Mining Collect 2 ore card for each structure adjacent to a ore tile Diplomat Move one of your own open roads or remove one of your opponents open roads Bishop Move robber or pirate to cell of players choice Intrigue Displace opponent knight that is on one of your roads Deserter Choose an opponent to remove one of their knights, then place one of equal strength. Saboteur Players with equal or higher victory points must discard half (rounded down) of their inhand cards Spy View and choose any one of a single opponents progress cards except victory cards Warlord Activate all your knights for free Wedding All players with more points give you any 2 commoditty or resource cards of their choice Harbor Force each player to exchange a commodity card of their choice for a resource card. If they have no commodity cards, then the trade is voided Master Merchant View and then take any 2 resource or commodity cards from another players hand who has more points Merchant Place the merchant on a land tile to recieve the 2:1 trade bonus for that tile type for as long as the merchant is on the tile Merchant Fleet Choose one resource or commodity to get a 2:1 trade bonus for that turn Resource Monopoly All players give you 2 resources of your choice if they have it Trade Monopoly All players give you 1 commodity of your choice if they have it Hire Knight Position new basic inactive knight for cost of %s Activate Knight Activate one of your knights for cost of %s Promote Knight Promote one of your knight for cost %s Move Knight Move one of your active knights. Position next to robber to reposition the robber. Can displace another players knight of lesser rank Attack Road Pick a road adjacent to the knight and roll a die. If the die roll+knight level is greater than or equal to %d then the road is removed form the board Attack Structure If knight level+die roll is greater than or equal to %d, then settlement destroyed If knight level+die roll is greater than or equal to %d, then city reduced to settlement If knight level+die roll is greater than or equal to %d, then wall removed If knight level+die roll is greater than or equal to %d, then metropolis reduced to city Roll dice Determines resource distribution. Rolling a seven causes the Robber sequence when enabled. Accept Ships Show ship choices Roads Show road choices Set Dice Click the dice to set value manually
Can assign any values to the dice on your turn Collect 1 victory point played immediately upon drawing, cannot be taken. Collect 1 victory point played immediately upon drawing, cannot be taken.

Settlers of Catan Num Settlements during Start Num Resources for City Num Resources for Settlement Points for City Points for Settlement Max number of safe cards in hand Min Longest Road Length Min largest Army Size Point to Win Enable Road Block Minimum players Maximum players Seafarers Expansion Enable seafarers expansion Enable Island Settlements on Startup Points for discovered Island Resources for Discovered Territory Robber enabled Pirate Fortress Health Ships can be built from any port regardless if there is a settlement. Warship can chase away pirate and attack opponents normal ships. Minimum discovered territories for victory points. Set to 0 to disable feature. Attacking a Pirate fortress ends turn flag. Default is true based on original rule set. Cities & Knights Expansion Enable Cities and Knights Barbaian Steps to attack Max Progress Cards Additional safe cards per wall Points per Metropolis Allow knights to venture off roads 1 unit at a time Indicate the min die roll (offset by knight level) needed to destroy a road. Set to 0 to disable. Indicate the min die roll (offset by knight level) needed to destroy a settlement. Set to 0 to disable. Indicate the min die roll (offset by knight level) needed to destroy a city. Set to 0 to disable. Indicate the min die roll (offset by knight level) needed to destroy a walled city. Set to 0 to disable. Indicate the min die roll (offset by knight level) needed to destroy a metropolis. Set to 0 to disable. When true, inventor can swap any tiles, otherwise 2,6,8 and 12 cannot be swapped as per original rule set. Traders & Barbarians expansion Use Event Cards instead of dice Min Victory Points for a player to have Robber placed adjacent to them Player with most harbor points gets special victory points
